newsitem.title: THAILAND: ASEAN opposes extra EU standard on frozen poultry.
newsitem.headline: ASEAN opposes extra EU standard on frozen poultry.

text.p: Representatives from ASEAN trade and public sectors on Tuesday resolved to oppose any move by the European Union to adopt ISO 9000 standards on chicken meat to the European market, officials said.
At a meeting here to discuss boosting of the region's commodities sales, the delegates said subscription to such standards should be made on a voluntary basis and not forced.
The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) groups Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, the Philippines, Singapore, Brunei and Vietnam.

"Non-tariff barriers are increasingly being used. Many countries are using standards that are higher than international standards and using sanitary and phyto-sanitary standards to obstruct trade," said a report issued by the delegates.
"ASEAN also should confirm its position on the issue of EU's trend to adopt ISO 9000 on chicken meat to EU market that this should be on voluntary basis not compulsary basis," it said.
ASEAN produced around one million tonnes of chicken meat in 1996 and exported 170,000 tonnes the same year to Hong Kong, China, Japan and the European Union.
The biggest producer of chicken meat in ASEAN is Thailand which recorded 830,000 tonnes of output in 1996, followed by Singapore.

Moreover, the group said it may encourage the EU to provide some more special quotas to ASEAN as the European group gave special quotas without tariff rate or with lower tariffs to some other countries.
